content:
Garlic roasted vegetables are a fantastic way to enjoy the flavors of garlic bread without the refined carbs. Here are some specific recipe suggestions to get you started:

**Recipe 1: Garlic Roasted Broccoli**

* 1 head of broccoli, broken into florets
* 2 cloves of garlic, minced
* 2 tablespoons olive oil
* Salt and pepper, to taste
* 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese (optional)

Toss broccoli florets with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper on a baking sheet. Roast at 425°F (220°C) for 15-20 minutes, or until tender and caramelized. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, if desired.

**Recipe 2: Garlic Roasted Cauliflower**

* 1 head of cauliflower, broken into florets
* 3 cloves of garlic, minced
* 2 tablespoons olive oil
* Salt and pepper, to taste
* 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley

Toss cauliflower florets with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper on a baking sheet. Roast at 425°F (220°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and golden brown. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

**Recipe 3: Garlic Roasted Brussels Sprouts**

* 1 pound Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
* 2 cloves of garlic, minced
* 2 tablespoons olive oil
* Salt and pepper, to taste
* 1/4 cup chopped pecans (optional)

Toss Brussels sprouts with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper on a baking sheet. Roast at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and caramelized. Sprinkle with chopped pecans, if desired.

**Recipe 4: Garlic Roasted Asparagus**

* 1 pound fresh asparagus, trimmed
* 2 cloves of garlic, minced
* 2 tablespoons olive oil
* Salt and pepper, to taste
* 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese (optional)

Toss asparagus spears with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper on a baking sheet. Roast at 425°F (220°C) for 12-15 minutes, or until tender and slightly caramelized. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, if desired.

These recipes are just a starting point, and you can always adjust the ingredients and seasonings to your taste. Feel free to mix and match different vegetables, herbs, and spices to create your own signature flavors!

Remember, the key to garlic roasted vegetables is to use high-quality ingredients, especially when it comes to the garlic. Fresh garlic will give you a more vibrant flavor, while roasted garlic will add a deeper, nuttier taste. Experiment with different garlic varieties and roasting times to find your perfect combination!
